channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Entertainment
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'Rogue One' lands with $290 million worldwide box office debut
'SNL' mocks Trump, Putin and ties with Exxon CEO
item.description: After being criticized by the President-elect as "mean-spirited" and "not very good," Alec Baldwin and his impersonation of Donald Trump returned on "Saturday Night Live" this week.

item.title: 'The OA' mysteriously arrives on Netflix
item.description: What to do with a show that largely defies simple description? Why not just sneak it out, in what amounts to a stealth campaign?

item.title: Denzel Washington brings 'Fences' from stage to screen
item.description: Star-director-producer Denzel Washington brings August Wilson's play to the screen with considerable power if not much imagination.

item.title: Common: Movies like 'Moonlight' are more important than ever
item.description: Recording artist, actor and producer Common was pumped to see his friend Mahershala Ali score a SAG Award nomination for his role in "Moonlight" Wednesday morning.

item.title: 'Barry' zeroes in on formative window in Obama's early life
item.description: Early-onset nostalgia about President Obama gave rise to a pair of biographical movies this year: "Southside With You," imaginatively chronicling his first date with future First Lady Michelle; and now "Barry," which also visits Young Mr. Obama in his college years, this time as he arrives at Columbia University in 1981.

item.title: Denzel Washington talks #OscarsSoWhite
item.description: Denzel Washington knows firsthand the struggle for actors of color in Hollywood.

item.title: Trump could learn a lot from Rogue One
item.description: Rogue One's wildly diverse cast, appearing on screens a month before Trump assumes the presidency is height of irony -- a master class in harmony and shared potential for the least inclusive President in modern history.

item.title: Kim Kardashian West easing back into limelight
item.description: Kim Kardashian West appears to be slowly coming back to us.

item.title: 'Carpool Karaoke' recruits celebs for ode to Mariah Carey's 'All I Want for Christmas'
item.description: All Mariah Carey wanted for Christmas was for James Corden to sing her song, "All I Want for Christmas." And the "Late Late Show" host was more than happy to oblige in the latest "Carpool Karaoke."

item.title: Is Lamar Odom headed for a new reality show?
item.description: Lamar Odom has checked into rehab and now there is speculation that his recovery may get the reality show treatment.

item.title: First pics of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
item.description: If you were in London recently and happened to notice a ginger strolling down the street with a brunette, it may have been a royal sighting.

item.title: 'SNL' targets Trump, Putin and Tillerson
item.description: Alec Baldwin and his impersonation of Donald Trump returned to "Saturday Night Live" this week. CNN's Cyril Vanier has more.

item.title: How movies teach us different kinds of life lessons
item.description: Every film tells a story. But certain movies, like the "Star Wars" series, do more than just entertain -- they inspire.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds' daughters make public debut
item.description: The daughters of Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively made their first public appearance on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

item.title: Tributes from Alan Thicke's sons
item.description: No longer in the Thicke of it. CNN's Jeanne Moos pays tribute to writer, composer and actor Alan Thicke.

item.title: SAG Foundation puts spotlight on actors in need
item.description: For actors, the road to success is filled as many potholes as there are stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

item.title: Alan Thicke was the TV dad beloved by a generation
item.description: The role of psychiatrist and father Jason Seaver on "Growing Pains" was the best gig Alan Thicke almost didn't get.

item.title: 'Manchester by the Sea' leads SAG nominations
item.description: Nominations for the 23rd annual Screen Actors Guild Awards will be announced Wednesday.

item.title: SAG Awards nominations: The complete list
item.description: Nominations for The 23rd annual Screen Actors Guild Awards were announced Wednesday.

item.title: Why K-2SO will be your new favorite 'Star Wars' droid
item.description: "Star Wars" has introduced some of the most beloved characters in movie history, and a lot of them weren't even human.

item.title: Julia Louis Dreyfus wins Best Reaction to Golden Globe nomination
item.description: And the award for Best Reaction to a Golden Globe nomination goes to Julia Louis Dreyfus.

item.title: 'America's Next Top Model' has a new look
item.description: Rita Ora has been watching "America's Next Top Model" for almost half her life, and now the 26-year-old the multi-hyphenate is taking her love for the show to a new level as host of the model competition series.

item.title: 'La La Land' designer on movie's dreamy fashion
item.description: Mary Zophres' official "La La Land" credit might list her as a costume designer, but anyone who's seen the modern-day romantic musical knows that's almost an understatement.

item.title: 'Fuller House' cast reflects on a major homecoming, show's success ahead of Season 2
item.description: The last time Jodie Sweetin stood on the steps outside the red-doored Victorian row house featured in the "Full House" opening credits, she was about 6 years old.

item.title: 'Rogue One' dazzles as it expands 'Star Wars' universe
item.description: "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" answers the question of whether that galaxy far, far away is big enough to sustain multiple offshoots with an emphatic yes.

item.title: Young Barack Obama struggles with identity in 'Barry' clip
item.description: As the country prepares to bid farewell to outgoing President Barack Obama, Netflix is looking to introduce people to a guy known to his friends as Barry.

item.title: Fox's 'Star' plays like pallid 'Empire' knockoff
item.description: To the victor goes the spoils, so after the success of "Empire," it's hardly a shock that Fox would explore whether producer-director Lee Daniels has another TV hit in him. Yet the result, "Star," is a pallid gender-switch imitation of that earlier hit, with acting and writing less reminiscent of its ostensible inspiration than the movie "Showgirls."

item.title: ... But 'Star' creator Lee Daniels doesn't agree
item.description: Lee Daniels knows fans and critics can't resist the urge to compare his new show "Star" to his hit series "Empire."
